Well I can answer this one for you. There is a strong belief that the ability to take damage ruins the game. So instead of allowing anyone to take damage and survive they allow noone. 

So when a tank gets called op because their damage is too high for their beefyness they nerf their TANK stats. 
Now we are left with a shell of a game that is "I outplayed you by oneshotting you first"

In a perfect world, tanks would be largely unkillable, and largely ignorable aside from their CC.  The only reason you'd focus a tank is because they're stopping your team from accomplishing their goals - IE killing people.  Not because they're a HUGE damage threat.

In an ideal world, you'd be telling your team "Walk past him.  get past him.  don't focus him, focus the high value targets.  You're playing right into his hands!"

In our world, its more like "HOLY SHIT KILL THE TANK, KILLL THE TANKKK!! HE'S MURDERING EVERYONE!!!"

Tanks, in any real strategy game, are there to distract and disrupt.  That's their job.  That's their ONLY job.

Tanks in league of legends function as basically another carry, except they're a carry that can take more than one shot to the face before blowing up - making them somtimes even MORE valuable than the ACTUAL carries.

> [{quoted}](name=Barkley,realm=NA,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=eE6JVyow,comment-id=000400000000,timestamp=2018-02-02T22:27:51.861+0000)
>

> Tanks, in any real strategy game, are there to distract and disrupt.  That's their job.  That's their ONLY job.

I think you're delusional or mistaken. Tanks in strategy and action games alike are very often battle tanks, which are used in _real life _military to punch through fortifications and frontlines with their large caliber cannon. That is the evolution of modern warfare. 
Thats the beauty of the birth of the gasoline and diesel  engine: Instead of lugging a large caliber cannon with the men exposed to war elements while trying to break through the trenches of world war 1, the British devised a metaphorical mechanized iron turtle outfitted with diverse armament coupled with several millimeters of riveted steel plate that had the engine doing the heavy lifting. 
Not only was this effective, but it changed the way war was fought forever.

But for some reason when a video game genre called a MOBA came out, people started to really confuse the integrity of the word "tank" with some sticky meatshield abomination, instead of a deasil driven, heavily-armored siege weapon-  the antithesis of fortifications.

Tank has had a special meaning in gaming long before MOBAs were a thing.  They were generally useful in holding aggro from bosses and surviving the blows while their squishy dps teammates whittled that boss down in relative safety.

Proving your point:

http://www.baldursgatemods.com/forums/index.php?topic=4283.0

"Tank" as a term for a meatshield is actually just a general term in video games, and has existed for a while. It honestly doesn't make any sense though, compared to the real thing; the real thing is not only hard to kill but also capable of being quite the threat, and required that you have special weaponry to even take it out.

For the longest time video games have referred to the durable disruption bots that don't hurt as "tanks" when really it makes no sense.

Riot had 2-3 good years (season 3-5) where they started reworking and removing all the cancer from the game, all the point and click crowd control & one shot non sense (assassins had crowd control back then, kassadin, talon, leblanc etc all had silence, fiora with her one shot R button, stuff like veigar R, anivia E, annie R, zilean Q got changed, taric, sion etc with their point and click stun got reworked), but somewhere in season 6 they stopped doing that and now we are back in the dark age of LoL, with the chogath, malzahar, syndra, rengar revert, leblanc revert, camille release with broken point and click spells and other one shot garbage, and all those point blank crowd control skill shot spells that last an eternity (with the new zoe E as the cherry on top).

The real question is how long this dark period is going to last before they get their sh:t together again, if ever.
